hopobject.body:
BeagleBone & BeagleBone Black Capes

See the Capes »

To view the selection of capes (manufactured by and sold via Circuitco), visit BeagleBoneCapes.com.

What are capes?

“Capes” are expansion boards that add functionalities to the BeagleBone and BeagleBone Black boards by plugging directly in via the boards’ 92 pin headers. Naming the plug-in boards “capes” (in reference to the cape worn by a beloved beagle superhero cartoon), the BeagleBoard.org community has designed the plug-in boards to foster an even wider range of innovations: robot motor drivers, sensors that measure location and pressure, LCD screens, battery power, and more.

The capes are products of the BeagleBoard.org community, which means they were designed by developers just like you and, although a variety of capes exist today, we can’t wait to see what cool new cape concepts come next. You have the chance to put your thinking cap on and tell us what we’ve missed by conceptualizing and designing your own cape plug-in board! Register your idea today.

There are now over 50 capes for display (DVI-D, HDMI, VGA, LCD, etc.), motor control, prototyping and power supply (battery, solar, etc.) – among other functionalities – with more on the way. What will you create?

Check out the list of registered cape concepts and register your own concept. To jumpstart your design, snag your own cape plug-in boards at BeagleBoneCapes.com.

Take a look at the list of and register your own. You can purchase some of the capes via the CircuitCo BeagleBone Cape page which attempts to log all of the capes currently available for sale:

BeagleBoneCapes.com

Featured Capes & Accessories

Explore the world of feature-rich capes and other accessories for super-charged functionality. Plug in and go! Visit the cape store to see all options.
